citeinfo.origin: (creation): Bureau of Transportation Statistics, Federal Railroad Administration
citeinfo.title: RAILROAD_AMTRAK_NTAD_IN: Amtrak Station Locations in Indiana (National Transportation Atlas Database, 100,000, Point Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: Data is from the National Transportation Atlas Database (NTAD) produced by the Bureau of Transportation Statistics, Federal Railroad Administration. To find out more about the National Transportation Atlas Database, visit HTTP://www.bts.gov/gis/ntatlas/natlas.html. Dataset is one layer in the Indiana Statewide GIS Database funded by Indiana Department of Transportation.

descript.abstract:
National Transportation Atlas Database metadata states -
"The Amtrak Stations database is a geographic data set containing Amtrak intercity railroad passenger terminals." "Attribute data include services and passenger amenities provided at the station."
Data includes Amtrak railroad including some old stations that closed. Data currentness is reported at July 2000. Data does not include regional commuter railroad stations that also serve as Amtrak service, only stations in the Fixed-Guideway Transit Network. See Completeness report for more detail on station inclusion.
descript.purpose:
BROAD, GENERAL information for planning, development, and research in Indiana National Transportation Atlas Database metadata states -
"The data set provides location and attribute information for use in national and regional cartographic and network analysis applications."

attracc.attraccr:
Bureau of Transportation Statistics metadata reports -
"Attribute data were extracted from the station listings in the Spring/Summer 2000 Amtrak National and Summer/Fall 2000 Amtrak Northeast Timetables, and reflect station characteristics as of July 9, 2000. Additional data, as required, were obtained from earlier year timetables."

dataqual.logic:
Bureau of Transportation Statistics metadata reports -
"All point records are represented by a single coordinate pair and a unique feature identifier; the Amtrak Station Code (stored in the FEATURID field). Attribute data can be matched to specific point records using this identifier."
dataqual.complete:
Bureau of Transportation Statistics metadata reports -
"The database includes all Amtrak railroad and thruway bus stations listed in the Amtrak timetables mentioned above. Also included are 1)Amtrak railroad stations listed in earlier releases of this database that are now closed and 2) future Amtrak stations that can be identified from either their inclusion in the timetables or published intentions to increase Amtrak service. Regional commuter railroad stations that are not also served by Amtrak are not included in this version; those stations are currently included in the Fixed-Guideway Transit Network database. The database does not include information on passenger boarding's; those data are considered to be proprietary by Amtrak."

horizpa.horizpar:
Bureau of Transportation Statistics metadata reports -
"Stations having valid street addresses were geocoded to 1995 TIGER/Line(TM)street and railroad centerline files. Positional accuracy for those points is consistent with the accuracy of 1995 TIGER/Line(TM) files, or within about 50 meters of their true position. Stations with ambiguous or incomplete street addresses were positioned using a combination of street name, nearest railroad centerline, and place name. Positional accuracy for these points may vary from 100 to 1000 meters of their true location. The PA attribute indicates the estimated 'goodness' of the location."

vertacc.vertaccr: Vertical accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of the data set. No quantitative tests were performed.

citeinfo.title: Amtrak Spring/Summer National and Summer/Fall Northeast Timetables

srcinfo.srccontr: Passenger station addresses and characteristic attributes

citeinfo.title: National Transportation Atlas Database, Amtrak Stations

srcinfo.srccontr: Shapefiles downloaded from the NTAD Website, HTTP://www.bts.gov/gis/ntatlas/natlas.html

procstep.procdesc:
Bureau of Transportation Statistics metadata reports -
"Each Amtrak railroad or thruway bus station identified in the Amtrak Timetables was initially geocoded based on its street address and ZIP Code, using the geocoding procedures in TransCAD (TM) software and the TIGER/Line(TM) 1995 street centerline databases. Stations with ambiguous street addresses were then located using a combination of geographic cues, including location of nearest railroad tracks, location of Standard Point Location Code (SPLC) place names, location of Census Named Places, and commercial road atlases. Stations with no street address and stations located in Canada were manually located based on place name and location of nearest railroad service."
CREDIT
"The Federal Railroad Administration compiled the data building on version 3 of these data compiled by Bruce D. Spear and published by the Bureau of Transportation Statistics."

cntaddr.address: Office of Policy, RRP-20, Mail Stop 15

procstep.procdesc: Amtrak locations created in TransCAD were converted to ArcView shapefiles and made available for download from the website for the National Transportation Atlas (HTTP://www.bts.gov/gis/ntatlas/natlas.html). See Process Contact for details about this step.

cntaddr.address: Office of Policy, RRP-20, Mail Stop 15

procstep.procdesc: Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates downloaded the Amtrak stations shapefile from the National Transportation Atlas Database website (HTTP://www.bts.gov/gis/ntatlas/natlas.html) and selected out only those stations in the state of Indiana. File was transformed from geographic, to UTM Zone 16, NAD83, meters. Fields RR3-6 were deleted because no information existed in this subset.

The following field were deleted from the dbf table using ESRI ArcView 3.2 because the fields provided little or no information: State, StFips, Version, Revision, Pa . The file was saved as a UTM 16, NAD83 projection.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit. v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: The SHAPE attribute is a data attribute inherent to the ESRI shapefile format. It defines the vector data as either a point, polyline, or polygon. For further information concerning the definition of SHAPE, consult ESRI documentation.

edom.edomvd: A "Point" is a combination of two numbers (often a latitude and a longitude) used to represent a location on a surface.

attr.attrdef: PointID is a sequential unique integer assigned to each record.
Amtrak station code - a unique three character identifier assigned to the Amtrak station
The longitude of the point in decimal degrees with six implied decimal places
The latitude of the point in decimal degrees with six implied decimal places
Amtrak station name
Street address of station; Earlier timetables were used to obtain some addresses
Name of city where station is located
Postal ZIP Code for station

codesetd.codesetn: National ZIP Code and Post Office Directory

attr.attrdef: Station status in 2000

edom.edomvd: ACTIVE = Open; CLOSED = Closed

attr.attrdef: Operator of Amtrak service at that point

codesetd.codesetn: The Association of American Railroads' Rule 260 four character reporting/identification mark of the railroad providing train operations for Amtrak at that station.
codesetd.codesets: Official Railroad Station List, The Official Railway Guide, The Official Railway Equipment Register

attr.attrdef: First additional operator of Amtrak service at that station

codesetd.codesetn: The Association of American Railroads' Rule 260 four character reporting/identification mark of the railroad providing train operations for Amtrak at that station.
codesetd.codesets: Official Railroad Station List, The Official Railway Guide, The Official Railway Equipment Register

attr.attrdef: Ticket office in station

edom.edomvd: Y = Yes; N = No; " " = Not applicable, closed or future station

attr.attrdef: Station has checked baggage; The existence of checked baggage does not imply that all trains serving that station also have checked baggage service.

edom.edomvd: Y = Yes; N = No; " " = Not applicable, closed or future station

edom.edomvd: Y = Yes; N = No; " " = Not applicable, closed or future station

attr.attrdef: Station is wheelchair accessible available

edom.edomvd:
F = Full - all station facilities are wheelchair accessible
P = Partial - wheelchair accessible path exists between street and train platform.
N = Not wheelchair accessible
" " = Not applicable, closed or future station

edom.edomvd: Y = Yes; N = No; " " = Not applicable, closed or future station

R = Full service restaurant
S = Snack bar
V = Food vending machines
N = Not applicable
" " = Not applicable, closed or future station

edom.edomvd: Y = Yes; N = No; " " = Not applicable, closed or future station

edom.edomvd: F = Free parking; N = No parking

attr.attrdef: Car rental available at station

OC = Call for service (on call)
N = No taxi service
Y = Taxi stand at station

edom.edomvd: Y = Yes; N = No; " " = Not applicable, closed or future station

edom.edomvd: Y = Yes; N = No; " " = Not applicable, closed or future station

edom.edomvd: Y = Yes; N = No; " " = Not applicable, closed or future station

edom.edomvd: N = No

attr.attrdef: The Standard Point Location Code of the station/city; Only those locations that have a corresponding rail freight station have an SPLC entered
The value of the node in the FRA 1:2Million and 1:100K scale networks corresponding to the station; Only those stations which had an exact match with a node were given values

distinfo.distliab: No claims to accuracy are made on this data. It is intended to be used only for general planning purposes. Detailed planning or analysis will require more accurate data. metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the BLA/IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. BLA/IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the BLA/IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
